reviewText:
Sound for the rental worked great for me, but you may have to watch it in Adobe Flash instead of Silverlight. Love, love, love this movie! It's like a modern indie film done in a classic Hitchcock style. There's a review online: http://www.gofreakmedia.com/news/2015/01/11/house-behind-wall/
Intriguing story, excellent and great-looking cast, and lots of fun to watch. I wish there were more films like this out there. Check it out!
This one is good im from newport news.right next door to hampton van this paranormal type horror love this
Don't miss this movie.  Saw the premire.  Must buy for my collection.  So nice to see Hampton roads on the big screen.

Love, love, love this movie! It's like a modern indie film done in a classic Hitchcock style. There's a review online: http://www.gofreakmedia.com/news/2015/01/11/house-behind-wall/
Great story, excellent cast, and lots of fun to watch. I wish there were more films like this out there. Check it out!

I had the opportunity to see the premier of The House Behind the Wall.  Being filmed at historic Ft. Monroe, Va., the setting adds credibility to the ghosts of Ft. Monroe, and this one in particular.  Camera work is outstanding, and it will keep you on the edge of your seat.  One of the better YA films I have seen in a long time.
Captivating storyline with a very attractive cast!  Great film.
Super great movie--enjoy!
I enjoyed seeing the footage of historic fort Monroe.
Absolutely horrible.

This movie had a little entertainment value, but for the most part you are just waiting for something, anything to happen.  It's only at the very end that the movie picks up any sort of speed or action.  The rest is just doldrums that does nothing for the story itself.
A WASTE OF $2.99!!!!
good
It was ok. I don't feel like I wasted my time. Didn't love it but I liked it.

Unnecessary sexual situations for a horror movie.
End made no sense
Too much cursing

I watch a fair amount of independent horror films, and you can definitely make a decent movie that way if your writing is good and you've got at least passable equipment and sound.

Unfortunately, this movie doesn't really have either.  Does it have some good-looking young coeds?  Sure.  But just because that's all you ever see in scary movies doesn't mean that's ALL you need.

To be fair, the actresses did not do a terrible job, they just weren't given much to work with. And to be frank the most egregious sin in this movie was the sound mix.  So bad!  Half the time you can hardly hear the dialogue because the "scary music" is so, so loud.  Similarly, there's a lot of slow walking up and down the stairs or hallways in this movie, and the footsteps are incredibly loud.  Ridiculously loud.  I can't believe the filmmaker didn't watch this and cringe (and then immediately fix it).

Unfortunately, it lends the whole film a very amateurish feel.

I think the good reviews are friends, family, and people who live in the area who are excited to see their local legend "on the big screen", as it were.

The people who are really criticizing this movie obviously are not part of the target audience. The House Behind the Wall is an independently produced horror film about a real lie apparition done up in the traditional style of ghost telling from the 70s and 80s. The cast members are fantastic, the story is filled with drama and suspense building elements. Is this Paranormal Activity? No. Is this going to scare you senseless? No. But if you like old school ghost stories (let's say Amityville Horror, for reference in story progression not for comparison) then this could be the movie for you. give it a shot.

I was anxious to watch this movie as it is filmed in Tidewater, Virginia - at Fort Monroe.  I read a lot about it in our local newspaper.
It was neat to have two local young men create a movie !  And exciting.

However, the acting was SO bad I had a hard time finishing it.  The actor's were horrible - and that ruined the plot and story for me completely.

About as witless and not-horrifying as you can get while making a supposed horror film. We meet four wealthy and one not-wealthy Southern college "students" who rent a house together for what seems like endless summer, although they're supposedly going to class. After interminable conversations about their pointless lives and activities, you start rooting for some slaughter just to end it all. Many, many buildups to climaxes that don't arrive, and repeated scenes of the "students" going into an empty basement with no payoff. And just to get a bottle of wine from a box in the farthest room along. I thought at first, "OK, it's really a potion, and they'll all see the ghosts and attack each other" but it was just wine. Then I kept saying, "Since you're drinking so much, just bring the whole box up!!!" But that would have been too easy. These are also the most subdued "college students" I've ever seen in a movie.
Of course it's fun to mock bad movies, but sheesh, this one messes up everything: A Civil War setup goes nowhere; scenes are brightly lit when it's supposed to be dark; the same mysterious sounds lead to nothing; a haunted student-rented house looks neater than something in Architectural Digest; and conversations mean nothing to the plot. After a few minutes, it's all about characters you wish you could murder yourself...I watched in sheer incredulity until it was over. (Yes, fine, I'm a glutton for punishment.) At one point, the camera even shook--a lot-- when a character got into a car, and not because there was a demon in it. The photography was actually quite good, if too clear and bright, so it seems more advanced than a student film, but comes across as more of a travelogue for Hampton Roads, Va than something calculated to chill your li'l ol' heart.

Just a bunch of people having inane conversations.  And, since they can't act, it is really really painful to watch.  I am happy to watch low production movies if they are interesting, off kilter,  or amusing (intentionally or otherwise).  This one was simply flat out terrible.

This isn't a fake review, haters. I don't need to prove to anyone I purchased it to leave a review, I just watched it at my local theater in Hampton, VA. I grew up next to Fort Monroe,  it's a real historical place with real local legends. This movie is a campy horror movie.  Anyone would know that's what they were watching.  For its genre it was fun and not badly done. Beautiful filming of local landmarks. Don't be so closed minded and boring.

This was a pretty good movie for not having Hollywood backing. It was slightly rough around the edges in some areas but it all it was decent and Def watchable. Brings you back to the college days of renting a huge house, drinking beers and having crazy things going on. The other reviews are probably old bags that couldn't make it through a scary people and didn't have fun when they were younger
Bad just watched it because I worked on Ft Monroe.  Bad script and horrible acting.

A good example of a filmmaking team who asked family and friends to post fake reviews. As you can see by all the downvotes of the 5-star reviews, the folks who paid money to watch this thing are pretty pissed off. I was even more angry in that I lived in Hampton Roads, and I've visited the forts, so I wanted very much to like this one. But, nope. I can see that the filmmakers did develop a local following via screenings in the Hampton Roads area (and in local news outlets) and - whether they asked people to or not - there are a ton of fake 5-star reviews.

All the fake 5-star reviews suckered me into it, though, I admit it, as I didn't bother to read the reviews in detail. Hopefully, this will save you the time and money.

Ugh. Another lame c-horror movie. Bad acting, dull plot, really bad CGI (in the few places it was used)... one of those videos you regret taking a chance on.

Plot: Haunted house, ghost of a jilted Civil War husband... No real blood or gore or even nudity (in fact, in the one scene two of the charcters were apparently having sex, I didn't even know it until they mentioned it later in the video - it's that bad). Just another bad microbudget weekend shoot, which was disappointing, as Im a huge fan of indie horror.

I thought the title was a bit intriguing, and the DVD artwork seemed cool... oh well. My bad.
Dumb!  Watched it three times and still cannot figure it out.  Waste of money.
Terrible acting. Don't waste your time.
Bad movie all around
Not very griping. Slow.
Don't waste your money..acting was horrible and the storyline boring..

Fake reviews galore for this film.  It's easy to spot the fakes, click on the name of the reviewer and you will see this is the only review they've published.  Also, most of the fake reviews are posted within the same period of time.
This movie is terrible. I only watched a half hour before I shut it off. Total waste of money.

Take one of the most haunted locations on the East Coast, start with a local legend of the Woman in White and create an old fashioned horror movie that gave me chills 4 or 5 times. Atmospheric shots of Fort Monroe in Hampton, VA, make it worth seeing for locals, and there's enough story to hold the rest. While some have panned it, I can honestly say it is far better than the SyFy made-for-TV movies.

Kudos to the filmmakers for a movie that gives us a glimpse into the supernatural that is right at the edge of everyday life.  If you are looking for a stereotypical blood and guts slasher film with tons of special effects, you'll be sorely disappointed.  But, if you are looking for a great subtle thriller  that leaves you just a little on edge when you hear a creak in the attic, this is the perfect choice.

This may be the WORST movie I have ever seen. I was sucked in by four and five star reviews. I don't know what those people watched but it could not have been this movie. There was also no trailer. I see why. If there had been I would not have wasted 2.99 and an hour and a half of my life. Consider yourself warned.
liked it
Not very good.

Fake Reviews! i'm pretty sure that whoever made this video camera movie had all of their friends and family members go and give it 5 stars -I couldn't make it 10 minutes it's literally a shakey video camera movie and not the good time. Upset that I rented this because at the time I rented it it had FOUR stars.. Avatar has 4 stars... come on....

This was one of the worst movies I've ever seen. I don't know what the rest of you were on that gave this movie the rave reviews you gave, but maybe I should have tried some of that first before I rented this.  The only reason I even gave it one star was it was the only way I was allowed to write this review.

Have watched lots of bad movies lately but after ten minutes could no longer deal with how bad this was,  Must be the inbreeding in hollywood,  Amazon should be ashamed for offering such an amateurish and poorly written and directed piece of dung,  The chicks weren't even appealing.
As I struggle in the world it irks me to see something so bad that someone who knew someone was probably able to make a fortune with despite their lack of talent , intellect and even effort.  The idjits who gave this a good review should be tested and put in homes where they can be taken care of cause they aren't bright enough to fend for themselves.
Boring and poor acting. Loudest footsteps ever in a movie.
This was pretty awful if you are over 16.

It was interesting as far as the quick story is concerned, the make up of the "zombie" and it's "acting" was a little corny, but I don't mind that .. this had the feel of an old school low budget b movie and that part is great.

What I don't care for is the fact I just spent money for a 16 minute experience..  if they could have panned this out to at least 30 minutes I'd feel more satisfied.. not like $2.00 is that much but that was just to rent it ..

All that aside.. I would totally pay to watch a full length version of it .. corny or not :) the scientist character was fun and there were at least two known actors in it  that I actually like .. so MAKE MORE! :) just not 16 minute snippets at a time ..

Seems that most of the reviews on here are not "verified purchasers" must be members of the production.

1) Cinematography was excellent with breath taking B role footage.
2) Sound was clear but choice of music allowed little suspense.
3) Really no suspense or jump scares for a horror movie, it kind of dragged on.
4) Characters were weak, unlikeable and cookie cutter.
5) Acting was above average, best actor was the Sheriff who had a minor role.
6) Screenplay was extremely weak.
7) Not scary at all, found the "white lady" or "lady in white" laughable.
8) Kudos to completing the movie.
No matter what I did, I could not get the sound to work for this moving. If you like silent films, this is the movie for you. The audio may play or it may not.
I'm sorry but this is a bad movie. I'm jus a retired housewife, 48yrs  old. Horror fan for 44yrs so my expectations are high but this movie sux, every way shape and form!
Cinematography was outstanding! Truly shared some beautiful areas in Virginia. This was a hip HORROR story that kept me glued to the edge of my seat! Totally worth the full price! Don't miss out!

HORRIBLE!!!  If I could give this movie ZERO stars I would.  And this has nothing to do with the sound, which was perfectly acceptable.  This movie has historically inaccurate set designs from the beginning.  The movie starts with a Civil War soldier coming home to find a 21st century woman and man in bed together.  The story makes absolutely NO sense, the acting is terrible, and it's surely not worth watching.  PLEASE! Do not waste your time.
Pissed off because of No Sound!

I like many others am not getting any sound, I hate giving 1 star without seeing a movie but with no sound I'm putting 1 star to help others who may experience this problem, if the sound gets fixed I will give a proper review
update, the sound is a Silverlight problem, I tried with adobe and it worked fine so im editing my review, the movie was ok, nothing great but not bad either so bumped up to solid 3 stars

If I could give this movie zero stars, that is what I'd do! The plot was weak as was the acting and the sound was just awful! I saw this movie had an average of 4 stars, so I was "sucked in"! How it got 4 stars is beyond me! I've seen much better horror movies that received only 2 stars! I wish I could get a refund, really!!!!!
no sound
Paid for it to watch and no sound?!?!?!
There is not sound.

What a great, suspenseful story and such beautiful cinematography. The Hitchcock review was right. It's a contemporary take on the classic horror films. Regarding the sound, it works well in Adobe Flash if your device is having trouble with Silverlight.
Great film with an interesting plot and history. The cast did an amazing job!! I would definitely recommend it!
no sound
Awesome movie with just the right amount of suspense.  Well written and beautiful scenery!
This is a great movie.  Great purchase for everyone's collection.  Love the story line and local Hampton history.  It's a keeper!!!
Was very excited to watch this... Too bad the "rent" option didn't have any sound....

Could have been much better if they hadn't focused so much on the interpersonal relationship nonsense; although I understand it was necessary as a platform on which to show how the possession evolves culminating in the fatal murders, but they could have done that in half the time and spared us a lot of boredom.
I really loved seeing Fort Monroe!!  Really miss being there!!  Great movie too!!

Enjoyed the movie from beginning to end! Suspenseful and wonderful writing allowed for development and understanding of individual characters. Clever entwining of past and present made for intense thrill watching!
WOW --  what a mess.  No trailer for a reason:)
I thought the setting of the fort was cool. Interesting story. Had some good scares.

This movie was great! Good thriller. It was very suspenseful and had me on the edge of my seat with my hands over my eyes. I like the history and legend behind the movie too, and how it relates to modern day society. Nice job linking fact with fiction. Nice scenic shots too.
Good sound--great movie!  Beautiful people that do a fine job.  The story is well written and super acting--enjoy this movie.

I first posted that there was no sound. Someone was kind enough to tell me to disable Silverlight so I did get to watch the movie after all and I'm so glad I did!

I'm originally from the area where this was filmed and it took me right back home in a matter of a couple minutes. Excellent job on location choice and filming!

The actors were better than many that I've seen recently. The didn't act like they were reading from a script. They made you feel like you were in the scenes with them.

I would watch this movie again.
The movie has NO Sound!!!!!!!can someone fix PLEASE!!!!!????
I saw the movie at the movie theater.  The version they sold me went from pg-rated to G-rated and was not as enjoyable

Love  the old fort
reminded me of the old fright flixs
It's terrible.
Was ok. Not really that scary.
bad
For me it didn't have enough scare, but it was okay.
Bad
Not worth the rental purchase but good if it were one of the free prime movies.  Very predictable and drawn out.
good
waste of money..
